intro: Mesembryanthemum croceum, commonly known as the yellow bush or sunstone, is a succulent plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, which is characterized by its fleshy leaves and colorful flowers. The plant produces bright yellow flowers that bloom in summer, often in clusters at the ends of its stems. Its leaves are thick and fleshy, adapted for storing water in arid environments. It is often used in rock gardens and xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
